text: Here are my top six weapons
to help you win in Destiny 2's
Trials of Osiris activity.
I picked these six weapons
based on player statistics
provided by Destinytracker.com
at the time of this recording
and my own experience
while playing Trials of Osiris.
The Chaperone, an exotic slug shotgun,

is one of the most-used
weapons in Trials of Osiris

and has the highest kill
and headshot percentage
out of any weapon listed.
It has the maxed-out range for a shotgun
and can easily defeat enemies
with one quick headshot at an instant.
Using this gives you the best opportunity

to defeat multiple
opponents in succession.
Felwinter's Lie, a legendary shotgun,

is the second-most-used
weapon in Trials of Osiris,

and it accounts for the
second-highest kill percentage,
behind The Chaperone.
Although its base range is not that good
in comparison to other shotguns,

it makes up for it with
its weapon perk slide shot,
which boosts range temporarily

and partially reloads the
weapon's magazine when you slide.

Also, you can increase its base
range by master working it.
With its tight spread shot,
it can take down anyone in its path.
Dead Man's Tale, the exotic scout rifle,
is an incredible option
for taking on mid- to long-range fights
in Trials of Osiris.
Even with its slow rate of fire,
it can cause a ton of damage quickly
by lining up precision shots in succession
due to its weapon perk cranial spike,
which grants you bonus damage
if your hits are precise.
When you line up those precise shots,

you can turn the tide of
a battle almost instantly.
The Messenger, a legendary pulse rifle,
is one of the best weapons to use,
with its lethal abilities
in mid- to long-range combat.
Since it is a high-impact pulse rifle,
it has a long range,

and you can eliminate an
enemy in only two bursts
as long as your version comes with either
the kill clip or headseeker weapon perks.
Overall, it is one of the most consistent
pulse rifles in the game.
It will not let you down.
Adored, the ritual legendary sniper rifle,

is a force to be reckoned
with in Trials of Osiris
due to its high versatility
to be whatever you need it to be.
If you need to be reactive

and able to zoom in
quickly to take a shot,
you can with its perk snapshot sites.
And the Vorpal weapon perk on this gun
will cause more damage to players

who are in the midst of
using their superability.
Either way, Adored has you covered.
The Last Word, an exotic hand cannon,
can wreak havoc in the hands

of any reactive player
ready to make a move.
Its fan fire perk allows you
to shoot from the hip more effectively.
You will also see how efficient it is
at eliminating the enemy
with its extremely high rate of fire
utilizing its full auto mode.
